The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: Let’s imagine there was NO part one of this game\, we’re introduced to this new character Ellie who see’s her friend Joel getting killed and then sets on this journey to seek vengeance. We play as Ellie and then as Abby.. This game would probably get 8-8.5. It’s by no means a perfect game\, but it’s fun\, not too bad of a story\, great graphics\, fun combat. However\, Playing this game after the original game is definitely a disappointment. We’ve already built a connection with Joel and Ellie\, and now we see Joel getting killed and then Ellie losing everything at the end of the game AND on top of that have to play for 10 hours as the character the killed Joel and expecting us connect to her! It felt exhausting and pointless\, I just didn’t care about Abby\, no matter how many times I interacted with the dog or played as her when she was young or went to the hospital where her father was killed! I DID NOT CARE. SHE KILLED JOEL. I played through the original game at least 5 times\, probably 10. I finished part 2 and will never touch it again\, that sums up the difference between the experiences we go through. Considering all of the above\, it’s still not fair to give the game a 2 or 3\, it’s clearly a well done game (mostly) and that’s why it’s a 6 for me.… Expand
